item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "If the events of September 11, 2001, have proven anything, it's that the terrorists can attack us, but they can't take away what makes us American -- our freedom, our liberty, our civil rights. No, only Attorney General John Ashcroft can do that." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Masashi Kishimoto
item.description: "She's strong! And scary...I bet she's single...I'd put money on it.." -- Masashi Kishimoto

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joseph Fielding Smith
item.description: "Satan has control now. No matter where you look, he is in control, even in our own land. He is guiding the governments as far as the Lord will permit him. That is why there is so much strife, turmoil, and confusion all over the earth. One master mind is governing the nations. It is not the president of the United States; it is not Hitler; it is not Mussolini; it is not the king or government of England or any other land; it is Satan himself." -- Joseph Fielding Smith

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "I've been to Canada, and I've always gotten the impression that I could take the country over in about two days." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Spencer W Kimball
item.description: "Our world is in turmoil. It is aging toward senility. It is very ill. Long ago it was born with brilliant prospects. It was baptized by water, and its sins were washed away. It was never baptized by fire, for that is still to come. It has had shorter periods of good health, but longer ones of ailing. Most of the time there have been pains and aches in some parts of its anatomy, but now that it is growing old, complications have set in, and all the ailments seem to be everywhere. The world has been ‘cliniced,’ and the complex diseases have been catalogued. The physicians have had summit consultations, and temporary salve has been rubbed on afflicted parts, but it has only postponed the fatal day and never cured it. It seems that while remedies have been applied, staph infection has set in, and the patient’s suffering intensified. His mind is wandering. It cannot remember its previous illnesses nor the cure which was applied. The political physicians through the ages have rejected suggested remedies as unprofessional since they came from lowly prophets. Man being what he is with tendencies such as he has, results can be prognosticated with some degree of accuracy." -- Spencer W Kimball

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love." -- Anonymous

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it)." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "If you take a book with you on a journey," Mo had said when he put the first one in her box, "an odd thing happens: The book begins collecting your memories. And forever after you have only to open that book to be back where you first read it. It will all come into your mind with the very first words: the sights you saw in that place, what it smelled like, the ice cream you ate while you were reading it... yes, books are like flypaper—memories cling to the printed page better than anything else." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul. It is daily admission of one's weakness. It is better in prayer to have a heart without words than words without a heart." -- Mahatma Gandhi
